title: Authentication Settings
description: Configure authentication methods for your Booklore instance. Internal authentication is always enabled, and you can optionally enable OIDC for external authentication providers.

methods.sectionDesc: Choose which authentication methods are available for users to sign in.

internal.label: Internal Authentication
internal.description: Built-in username and password authentication. This is the default method and cannot be disabled.

oidc.label: OIDC Authentication
oidc.description: OpenID Connect for single sign-on with external providers (Authentik, Keycloak, etc.).

providerConfig.sectionDesc: Configure your OIDC provider settings. All fields are required to enable OIDC authentication.
providerConfig.scopeHint: Required scopes for OIDC login. Must be supported by your provider.
providerConfig.claimDesc: Map OIDC token claims to Booklore user fields. These must match your provider's token claims.

provisioning.sectionDesc: Configure how new OIDC users are created and what permissions they receive.
provisioning.autoDesc: When enabled, new users are automatically created on first OIDC login with the permissions below. When disabled, users must be manually created in Booklore before they can log in via OIDC.
provisioning.selectLibraries: Select libraries new users can access

toast.providerError: Failed to save OIDC provider settings.
toast.provisionError: Failed to save OIDC auto-provisioning settings.
